Expansionist Ruler

Devapala was the most powerful ruler of the Pala dynasty. Under the leadership of his general Lavsena, the Pala army achieved victories up to Pragjyotishpur (Assam) and Odisha. He also defeated the Hunas, Gurjaras, and Dravidas.

тШ╕я╕П
Patronage of Buddhism

He continued to patronize Buddhism. At the request of Balaputradeva, the Shailendra king of Java and Sumatra, he granted 5 villages for the construction of a monastery in Nalanda.

Capital

He established his capital at Munger (Mudgagiri).
